str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Dative Feminine Singular
str2: The next day. Feminine singular participle of a comparative of epi and heimi; supervening, i.e. the ensuing day or night.
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To go in, enter (originally: I shall go in). From eis and eimi; to enter.
With. A primary preposition denoting union; with or together.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
The same as Iakob Graecized; Jacobus, the name of three Israelites.
And, both. A primary particle of connection or addition; both or also.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Comparative of presbus; older; as noun, a senior; specially, an Israelite Sanhedrist or Christian 'presbyter'.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From para and ginomai; to become near, i.e. Approach; by implication, to appear publicly.
